result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas A. Johnston-Burnett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Includes 10% surcharge - To be paid to Oneida County District Attorney within thirty (30) days

Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

Supervision fees

Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

1:39 p.m. Defendant Lucas A. Johnston-Burnett in court with attorney Robert Elwood Hanson.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bednar states agreement. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bednar/Hanson/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Jail - 9 months - Imposed and Stayed
Restitution - $39.42 to be paid to DA's office within 30 days
WHS/POP - 1 year
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample

Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.

Bail continued. Adj. 1:46 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 09-11-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant states he is represented by Attorney Bob Hanson but has not talked to him - right to counsel - Bednar/Defendant statement to bail.  Court sets additional $500 sig bond. Court quashes warrant.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
